intro: Calyptranthes heteroclada, commonly known as the variable calyptranthes, is a species of flowering plant in the family Theaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in countries like Mexico and Costa Rica. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, and it is often found in humid, shaded environments. The species is of interest to botanists due to its morphological variability and ecological adaptability.
